<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of do_append:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
do_append (char **ret,
           const char *data,
           size_t size)
{
  char *buf;
  size_t old_len;

  if (NULL == *ret)
    old_len = 0;
  else
    old_len = strlen (*ret);
  if (NULL == (buf = malloc (old_len + size + 1)))
    return MHD_NO;
  if (NULL != *ret)
  {
    memcpy (buf,
            *ret,
            old_len);
    free (*ret);
  }
  memcpy (&buf[old_len],
          data,
          size);
  buf[old_len + size] = '\0';
  *ret = buf;
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (NULL != *ret)
  {
    memcpy (buf,
            *ret,
            old_len);
    free (*ret);
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. In this function *ret is both freed and overwritten (*ret = buf), so the pointer must refer to mutable storage and cannot be changed to point-to-const. Rule 8.13 would only be applicable if the code merely read the pointee (e.g. only memcpy) and never freed or assigned it, in which case the parameter could be a pointer to const.
